meanings.definition: Placed or situated beneath or below something else.
meanings.sent1: The underlaid foundation supported the heavy structure above.
meanings.sent2: The underlaid rocks provided stability to the soil on top.
meanings.sent3: The underlaid carpet made the room feel cozy and warm.
meanings.sent4: Her underlaid knowledge of the subject helped her excel in the exam.
meanings.sent5: The underlaid roots of the tree reached deep into the ground for nourishment.

meanings.sent1: The underlaid fabric added extra warmth to the jacket.
meanings.sent2: The underlaid paper protected the table from scratches.
meanings.sent3: She wore underlaid gloves to keep her hands toasty in the cold weather.
meanings.sent4: The underlaid padding made the mattress more comfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent5: The underlaid paint gave the wall a smooth and even finish.

meanings.definition: Supported or reinforced by a layer beneath.
meanings.sent1: The underlaid beams strengthened the bridge's structure.
meanings.sent2: The underlaid wires provided additional support to the fence.
meanings.sent3: The underlaid frame made the painting stand out on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her underlaid arguments were backed up by solid evidence.
meanings.sent5: The underlaid mesh prevented the soil from eroding during heavy rain.
